Descartes said, "Doubt everything, until that which cannot be doubted is left". So I ask this to all; what don't you doubt?
But why? There needs to be a reason. Let me add that to my original post.

I doubt everything.
 
 I'm not even totally convinced by the 'I think therefore I am' either. How do I know I do think? I remember thinking, but my memories may well be false.
 
 But I am also an anti-skeptic. As far as I am concerned it doesn't matter, one just has to live life according to ones senses, to me it is real and that is all that counts. I live life by believing what is likely and logical.
 
 Which means practically I doubt the existence of God; the Father, the Son, and the Holy Spirit!

 You doubt, therefore, you exist. If this was all a facade, then what would we have to doubt? By doubting are we truly real.

You doubt, therefore, you exist. If this was all a facade, then what would we have to doubt? By doubting are we truly real.
But how do I know that I do doubt? I remember doubting but memories are faulty. I suppose I'd have to exist in some capacity to even have faulty memories, but it could just be as a figure in someone's dream, or a 'hologram' in some alien program, or something totally incomprehensible.
 
 Arrrgh Implodes under the weight of his own paranoia
 
 Sandy, how has God proven himself to you?

But how do I know that I do doubt? I remember doubting but memories are faulty. I suppose I'd have to exist in some capacity to even have faulty memories, but it could just be as a figure in someone's dream, or a 'hologram' in some alien program, or something totally incomprehensible.
 
 Arrrgh Implodes under the weight of his own paranoia
 
 Sandy, how has God proven himself to you?

 
 You doubt because if you didn't, then why are you typing what you are? Why is every word that comes from you an answer unto itself, undeniable proof that you're asking yourself the question "Why?". If you didn't doubt, then how can you doubt your ever doubting? Isn't that in itself doubt, or do you doubt that? You could be a program, but then again, if that were true, then what is the point? Where is the meaning to this program and what is it's function? We play games on the computer all the time, and who are we to know that we haven't played god and made the characters real, suspending time with the click of pause and resuming life as soon as we saw fit? Are we just another program, played out by another? So you do doubt, as much as you would like to deny that, you do, and there is nothing to prove otherwise. But the program never doubts its own existence then does it?
 
 Sandy, glad you have "volumes" to prove that God exists. If you saw my comment as an attack, then you were mistaken. It was simply a question, because I meant for those who post to give a reason behind their beliefs.
